Dear Ms. Koziara:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/5/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4128-3 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
• (3) The licensee shall document that each staff
person whose function is covered by these rules
has participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours
of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of
training annually thereafter related to the

employee's job function. At least 16 of the 50
hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of
duties.
One of three employee files reviewed lacked the required 25 hours of annual
training.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• 2024 Interim Inspection: Corrective Action Plan was recorded during this
reporting period as a result of the Interim inspection completed on 5/9/2024. This
CAP contained rule violations of CCI Rule 400.4113 (1) (j) Employee records
regarding two staff lacking evaluations, and CCI Rule 400.4156 (1) Institutions
not detention institutions or shelter care institutions; updated treatment plan
regarding one updated treatment plan not being completed within the 90 days.
The facility submitted a CAP that was approved on 5/29/2024 which contained
action steps to ensure employee evaluations were completed timely and updated
treatment plans were completed within 90 days and not tracked off three months.
The CAP was successful as there were no repeat violations found during the
Renewal inspection.

Financial Overview
Teaching Family Homes annual third-party audit report for fiscal year ending
September 30, 2022, was reviewed by the Bureau of Audit. The audit report
included financial concerns however the concerns are improving. Net assets
indicate the extent to which revenues exceed expenses and are an indicator of the
financial health of an organization. The agency has a deficit in total net assets in
the negative, however this has improved from the previous year’s audit. The facility
has a working capital in the negative, which indicates an agency's inability to pay
off its short-term liability if they came due immediately, however this too has
improved from the previous year’s audit. The facilities’ financial condition will
continue to be monitored in subsequent audits, however there is improvement in
this fiscal year's financial audit. Teaching Family Homes annual third-party audit
report for fiscal year ending September 30, 2023, is currently in draft status and
not finalized.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
since the last reporting period the corrective action plan that was implemented had
a positive impact on ensuring all areas are in compliance for the upcoming
inspection. Chief Administrator reported South Bluff currently does not have any
youth due to placing a placement pause on the house due to the facility facing
staffing issues. South Bluff has not had any youth in the house since mid-
December 2024. Chief Administrator reported currently the facility will need to hire
a social service worker and the current house supervisor is on a leave of absence
from the agency at this time.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews reported no concerns, and the facility is prepared to resume taking
placement at the home in the next couple of weeks.
The facility currently does not have any youth placed resulting in no youth
interviews being conducted.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walk through the facility occurred on May 5, 2025. There
were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
